description: The “distimed” Valor needs to accomplish the biggest mission of his life: repair the damaged timeline, or the future will cease to exist…except that the Linear Men believe it's vital that Valor be removed from the timeline now.
name: Sudden Death Overtime Part One: Ahead Of His Time

description: Mildred the Mother takes center stage as the Witches continue their attempt to exact vengeance for a brutal murder. In Victorian England, a young Sir Richard Francis Burton learns the ways of sorcery and of life, but the path he chooses may not suit the Witches' purposes.
name: Mother

person_credits.name: Roberta Gregory
person_credits.role: writer, editor, penciler, letterer, inker, colorist, cover

description: Michael heads to Philadelphia looking for the mysterious Order of the Cross.

name: The Sign of the Cross, Part 1

description: The Fiend possesses Doug Herman, a weak-willed nobody that possesses some hatred for Dragon. The Police try to enlist The Mace into the Police Force, who is also sought by The Vicious Circle.

Supreme Madness Part 3: In his madness, Supreme travels to NYC. In a narrow street, he meets Spawn. Strangely, Spawn sees in Supreme a friend and a man you are a hero when he was a kid.

Supreme tells him his complete life. Spawn does the same and concludes than Supreme doesn't have to complain about his story.

Upset than Spawn refuses to understand him, Supreme flies away leaving a thoughtful Al Simmons.
name: Supreme Madness, Part 3

description: Violator just wants to keep living the nasty life of a demon, but everyone wants to kill him. Even his siblings.
name: The World- Part III
On the Edge of Armageddon

volume.name: Star Trek: Deep Space Nine -- Hearts and Minds

description: Atom Bob and Grenade return to their old neighborhood to visit and hang out on their free time. Atom Bob wants to visit a bookstore but Grenade resists, opting instead to sign autographs for some adoring fans. Before too long, a man named Powerhouse arrives at the scene and battles Grenade and Atom Bob. Powerhouse hits Atom Bob hard and Grenade fights him with a fury. Powerhouse is an ultra that was struck by his own Jumpstart many years ago. While Grenade and Powerhouse fight, an invisible man named Pilgrim shows up and gets Powerhouse's personal information from the clothes and wallet he left hidden in an alley. Pilgrim claims that he will use this information to destroy the Strangers. Atom Bob comes back into the fight and Powerhouse flees. Grenade reveals to Bob after the fight that the reason he didn't want to enter the bookstore is because he was caught stealing years ago. However, he has learned responsibility and has become a better person, giving the money he owed to the bookstore owner.
name: The Man Of Power

description: A Crystal-centric issue! Crystal must save fellow inhuman Sporr from mad geneticist Terrigene. Who is Terrigene? And why is she so insistent on having Sporr’s DNA for herself?
name: The Inhuman Condition

description:
Overview

Americop! Kono the Sumo! A few reasons why Cap has gone down the beaten path!
name: The Beaten Path

description: Daredevil's war against System Crash continues! Every step takes him closer to the man pulling the strings- but little does Matt know that man is none other than Baron von Strucker, of the sinister organization Hydra! Guest-starring Captain America and the Ragin' Cajun, Gambit of the X-Men!
name: Tree Of Knowledge - Part 4: Disinformocracy

description:
First Story: Amid the Encircling Gloom

Second Story: Future History Part 2 Of 3
name: Amid the Encircling Gloom;  Future History (Part 2)

description:
It all happens here! The titanic, super-sized, 50th issue of THE GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY! Inside the foil-embossed cover, you will find the answers to all the questions that have been building up for so long!

Will the Hawk God keep Aleta and Stakar alive and/or physically fused? How serious is Talon´s back injury? Will Mephisto and Malevolence procure his amulet? Vance´s new suit - Yondu´s ultimate allegiance - the Beyonder´s destiny! And ultimately, how will the final fate of the Protege impact on all of this? You can be sure Eternity, Scathan the Celestial and the Living Tribunal will be heard from before all is said and done!
name: Coldly Sublime, Intolerably Just!;  Future History (Part 1 of 3);

description: A disgraced Skrull tries to earn respect by pounding on the Hulk.
name: The Last Waltz
Dance of the Hunter III - Alliance

description:
Final issue. Quasar takes a serious and definitive decision, and therefore takes a swift trip to say goodbye to all his firends and family.

Meanwhile, two of his old enemies are looking for vendetta on Quasar, and tail him until the very moment of beating him to death.
name: "The Long Goodbye"

description: A turning-point issue! In possession of the Moebius Stone, Malachi embraces his megalomaniacal nature to its fullest- and the world trembles. A new leader of the Secret Defenders appointed! But who?
name: On Borrowed Time

description:
Silver Surfer's return to Earth continues as he and the Fantastic Four visit Monster isle. Of course, Mole Man has not been informed about their good intentions and...well, you can just imagine what happens!

Summary
The Silver Surfer and the Fantastic Four arrive at Monster Island in an attempt to find a seismic disturbance. They plan to use the caverns under the island. But as they approach they are attacked by the massive monsters of the island, controlled by the Mole Man. Adam Warlock arrives and gets the monsters to cease their attack.

Warlock pulls the Surfer to the side to speak with him. Since they have seen each others souls, Warlock knows the Surfer well. He tells the Surfer to prepare himself for temptations. He and the Four are permitted to go into the caverns.
name: Down To Earth: 2

story_arc_credits.name: Beware the Rage of a Desperate Man

first_appearance_storyarcs.name: Beware the Rage of a Desperate Man

name: Live and Let Die, Part Two: Who Among Us?
What If War Machine had NOT destroyed the Living Laser?

description: Reprints X-Men #3
name: Beware Of The Blob!

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: Worlds Collide, part SIX! The Syndicate run amok in the remains of Metropolis, until SUPERMAN shows up. THEN they run amok on Superman! Continued in Worlds Collide.
name: Toys Of The Gods

description: Part 4 of 'Worlds Collide,' the 14-part DC/MILESTONE crossover event, continued from Superboy (1994 3rd Series) #6. Edwin Alva's exploitation of Fred Bentson's weird dream/reality shifting leads to Rocket's encounter with a strange visitor from another dimension...Superboy! Continues in Steel (1994) #6.
name: Living in a Dreamworld

description: In order to repay a favor, Kobalt goes against a personal oath and takes on a sidekick, Richard Page. But criminal activity intervenes and disrupts the training of his young charge. Plus, more about Kobalt is revealed on Page's first night out...perhaps much more than should be revealed!
name: Walking the Plank

description: Sideshow enlists Donner and Blitzen on a personal mission to lay a trap for members of the Arcadian League.
name: Female Trouble

description: David Kim escapes from the police, only to run into Rabbi and two Golems! Xombi the man who doesn't die, isn't even the FIFTH most bizarre creature in this issue!
name: Silent Cathedrals Part Two: Feats of Clay

first_appearance_teams.name: The Order of the Spoken Flame

team_credits.name: The Order of the Spoken Flame

description:
The Story of Goodtree's Treeshaping abilities are told.
The wolfriders try to convince Goodtree to claim her place as Chieftess, but she declines and goes on her personal pilgrimage. While ascending a mountain, she grabs at a root for a handhold, and it rips out from the earth. She falls back over a cliff, and her recognised partner Acorn goes into a coma when she does.
She needs to isolate herself and delve into meditation, communing with the ancestry of The High-Ones. What she discovers is the balance between divine talent and raw elemental mental force, thus unlocking the secret of the seed itself.
name: The Spirit Quest

description: Archer's just gotten an offer he can't refuse ? become the bodyguard of local crime kingpin or die! Then, when a rival family strikes makes their move their move in an impressive display of firepower, will Archer be forced to a save the man who represents everything he hates?
name: Bad Karma - Part II
The Dilemma

description:
Overview

While quakes continue to shake things up at Ice Station Hellman, a deadly virus has infected the workers there, causing them to explode! Believing that the mysterious Grendel Jonah is at the heart of their troubles, some of the workers conspire to remove him -- forever!

Also in this issue: Matt Wagner's back-up feature continues, as valuable clues emerge in the search for Grendel-Prime.
name: Chapter 3; Incisionary Tactics Part 2

volume.name: Grendel Tales: The Devil in Our Midst

description: Splash title = The Heart Of Saturday Night
name: The Return of Clea

description: KnightsEnd Part 4, continued from Detective Comics (1937- ) #676. While Batman continues his pursuit of the mysterious arms dealer, Lady Shiva's scheme to corrupt Bruce Wayne into a killer succeeds as, before the very eyes of Nightwing and Robin, Wayne slays the last of the martial arts assassins who have been stalking him! Continued in Robin (1993-2009) #8.
name: Devils

volume.name: Batman: Legends of the Dark Knight

description:
1. Something Fell (comic)

The throne breaks from the rest of the building and rises up. The Cirin/Cerebus fight stops

2. Something Fell (text)

Viktor and the reader go into a stadium. He proclaims comics are not like Rock 'n' Roll

3. Tyrant (8 page preview by Steve Bissette)

4. Cerebus and Deadface pin-up
name: Mothers and Daughters 34 : Something Fell

description:
Iceman's body may have woken up, but the person inside is...the White Queen?!

Emma Frost has long been an enemy of the outlaw mutants , The X-men. The last time we saw her she was rendered camatose and her students the Hellions all killed. Now she has awoken and taken possession of Iceman's body; But what will happen when she learns of the Hellion's death?

Emma Frost's journey to redemption begins here!
name: Early Frost

first_appearance_locations.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

location_credits.name: Jean Grey School for Higher Learning

description: John Constantine's final struggle with the First of the Fallen continues to unfold as Satan confronts his brothers and the balance of power in Hell begins to shift dramatically! Meanwhile, Helen's continued downward spiral brings more trouble for John. "Rake at the Gates of Hell" part 2.
name: Rake At the Gates of Hell, Part Two

description:
It is now eight years since Rachel Summers transported Scott “Slym”, and Jean “Redd”, into the future. Nathan Dayspring continues to hone his telepathic powers under the tutelage of his mother, but wonders why his parents insist he hide his cybernetic arm. After discovering that his parents are involved in a secret rebellion, Nathan must determine if he should side with his family, or Apocalypse.

Jean finds herself going through her old lessons with Nathan in an attempt to help him control his mutant powers. By night, however, Jean and Cyclops accompany the Clan Rebellion on missions attempting to overthrow Apocalypse. This mission, the group finds the progenitor to the Legacy Virus, are attacked by Ch'Vayre, and find a first meeting between Cable and Stryfe. The Clan also witnesses the mutant powers of the Dayspring family.

*References X-Factor #67 - Endgame (Part 3): Lunar Opposition!
name: Through the Years

volume.name: The Adventures of Cyclops and Phoenix

description:
Stranded in the Florida swamps, Cable and Lee Forrester struggle to survive! And if that's not enough, finding shelter in a small cottage only leads them to more despair!

Cable and Lee escape from a hurricane, but the house they find is not the shelter they want. Seemingly the abode of a kind old man, both Cable and Lee begin seeing some of the most depressing scenes from their lives. Unfortunately for them, they have wandered into the home of D'Spayre, a being that feeds off the fear in the lives of others. But it seems as if it were all a game because Belasco appears to stop D'Spayre and recruit Cable to take down a common enemy.

Synopsis

As Cable and Lee Forrester hike through the Everglades, a storm develops and sends the duo looking for shelter. Cable falls into some quicksand and has to use his telekinesis to free himself. This completely tires him out; fortunately, a house is soon found to pass the night.

Desmond, an old man that lives in the house, welcomes the two travelers. As the night passes, Desmond lets on that he knows an awful lot about Cable and Lee, even going so far as to drop their full names. Cable senses that something is amiss and attempts to bully Desmond into giving some answers. Instead, Cable has the memory of his wife's death and son's betrayal play out in his mind. Cable collapses to the ground as another individual enters the cabin. This man is named Lucas and he comments that he wanted to be present for the game before sending Cable and Lee off to bed.

Lee puts a despondent Cable to bed and notes her misgivings about the two men. In her room, her dad enters and proceeds to shoot himself in the head - the very way he had died after being tormented by a demon. Lee tries to run away from this memory and runs headlong into Cyclops and Magneto, two men she once had feeling for. Meanwhile, Cable sees visions of women in his life that have never stayed: Jenskot, Redd, Jean Grey, Rachel Grey, Mother Askani. He finds Lee, but his form is changed into that of Stryfe's. Desmond shows up and explains that Stryfe integrated his consciousness into Cable's and that devastation would surely come to pass if Stryfe were to become the dominant force in Cable's head.

Desmond drops his human form and reveals himself to be D'Spayre, a demon that gets his powers from the depression of others. Cable is racked with his memories but is able to fight through them to declare that he fears things, but he does not let that fear control him. To prove his point, Cable kisses Lee. D'Spayre threatens to destroy the two, but Lucas steps in and claims Cable and Lee as his own. Lucas drops his human form and reveals himself to be Belasco, a fallen demon. He needs Cable's help in defeating a mutual enemy.
name: Fear and Loathing, Part 2: A Kiss Before Dying!

description:
Overview

On the verge of death after his battle with White Lightning, Enemy is captured. Hospitalized, helpless, and unable to defend himself against assassins closing in on him, his only hope is FBI agent Jan Quillan. But in the wake of her partner's death, Quillan falls victim to a startling betrayal that threatens to destroy them both!

The original Batman is fighting his double while Catwoman is still trying to retrieve the enabler from the hands of Selkirk, the ambitious weapons dealer. The chaos that follows culminates atop the vilain's penthouse in a surprising climax...
name: KnightsEnd, Part Six: Fire In The Sky

deck: First in a four-issue retelling of Badger's origins
description:
In this series, which reveals yet another never-before-revealed secret origin for Badger, Daisy Fields is an ambitious young therapist who's just been assigned to Norbert Sykes, also known as Max Swell, Emily, Pierre, Gastineau, and... Badger! A world-class martial artist, a post-traumatic syndrome-suffering Vietnam vet, and full-blown multiple personality, Badger is the strangest and most dangerous case Daisy will ever take. If this weren't enough, Daisy's got to deal her drug-dealing boyfriend and a mysterious campus menace known only as The Phantom!

This four-issue limited series expands upon the events of Capital Comics' The Badger #1 - Precipitation. The premiere issue of this Dark Horse series coincided with the first issue of Badger: The Zen Pop Funny-Animal series, which examined Badger and his cast of characters through a different lens.

name: Hero

description:
Bruce Wayne is training in the woods outside Gotham while a ninja is trying to find him, sent by Lady Shiva.

Batman (Jean Paul Valley) is having hallucinations of St. Dumas and he tries to fight through them. Robin does some investigating of Valley and reflects that he's going crazy. Robin meets up with Bruce Wayne who invited Nightwing for a debriefing on what they know about Valley. Nightwing and Robin agree to join Bruce in taking down Valley.

Valley had been brainwashed since birth to become a "human machine for punishment and death" by his father, as has been done throughout his bloodline for centuries.

Meanwhile Batman (Valley) contacts Rudy Elzen and offers to meet him and give him semi-automatic guns in exchange for something. Lady Shiva's ninja emissary sets traps for Bruce Wayne while Robin and Nightwing take down a gang of thugs.

At the meeting with Rudy, Batman reveals he has no guns for him and threatens Rudy's life if he doesn't tell him where Carleton LeHah is. Rudy says he doesn't know anything and his goons attack Batman with a sledge hammer. This sets Batman off and he pummels the thugs, sending them fleeing, taking off Rudy's ear with a batarang before knocking him out. Valley confuses himself in his own mind, almost calling himself Azrael instead of Batman.

Meanwhile, Bruce Wayne wearing the Mask of Tengu, goes through the obstacle course booby trap setup by Lady Shiva's emissary. The ninja is upset because he thinks Wayne killed his sensei and attacks him. The fight eventually takes them into a River where Wayne bests him on a floating log. Back in Gotham, Wayne stands atop a gargoyle on a skyscraper with a rope in hand reflecting that this is where he first jumped off when he first became Batman. He backs off, not ready to take the plunge.
name: KnightsEnd Part Two: Manimal Proving Ground

description:
"The Fall of Metropolis" part 2. Metropolis has fallen but Luthor isn't finished. Just in case anyone survived his first strike, Luthor plants several fail-safes to finish the job!

Superman struggles with putting his city back together and confronts a woman who wants to seek her own form of justice in a now crime ridden city. But will this woman survive?

Notes:

  • On page 9 panel 4 the partial name of the grocery store "Garcia-Lo" is a homage to Jose Luis Garcia-Lopez.
  • Wonder Woman's cameo appearance is referenced to Wonder Woman #88.
  • *The triangle numbering for this issue was a misprint and is in fact #25 and not #28. It had later been addressed in Superman: The Man of Steel #0 issue in the letters column.
  • Triangle 1994 #28*.
  • Chronological continuation from Action Comics #700.
  • Chronological continuation in Superman #91.
name: Afterburn

description: After her fight with the Nameless One, Anima finds herself in Nevada, where she encounters a Navaho Indian tribe. The tribe knows of the Nameless One, and warns of his escape. At the nearby Nevada supercollider, which was built on a rift between Earth and Arkana, the Nameless One appears. He takes control of the scientists, and uses them as pawns to detonate the reactor. After a Navaho tribal ceremony, Anima learns of the Nameless One’s location, and goes there to defeat him. Anima and Animus stop the Nameless One’s plans, and follow the Nameless One back to Arkana. Meanwhile, Anima’s friend Liv deals with the repercussions of having HIV; Agent Woodleaf has tracked Anima down to Nevada, following Anima and animus through the rift to Arkana; Anima’s father Dwight Mason vows to get his wife and children back; and Jeremy Mason is tricked by Dr. Maxilla Yale into taking part in the same dream therapy treatments that his mother did.
name: Wheel of Fortune

description: The Legionnaires wait outside an emergency room for one of their own, as they recount how they were able to save Weber World, clear their name, and capture Universo. Unfortunately, their teammate paid the ultimate price and dies from complications. Meanwhile, Rokk Krinn has gone mad and has set out to New Earth to try and magnetically rebuild the Earth while Rond Vidar finds further proof that the timeline is collapsing.
name: Earthfall!

description: Beware the shrill cry of Shriek! Spider-Man must rescue Malcolm McBride from the delusional villain holding him captive. How does John Jameson play a part in Spidey’s plan? Plus, a heated confrontation between Aunt May and MJ!
name: Shrieking, Part Two: The Burning Fuse

description:
Supreme Madness Part 4:  Stormwatch had discover that Supreme went mad. They want to find him in order to help him or stop him but it's him who find them and attack. 
The battle begins in New York streets but Supreme reachs the Stormwatch's ship in order to destroy it. 
The fight goes on inboard when the Weatherman orders his team to fall back. 
In a last attemp, Hellstrike shots a Supreme and expels him from the ship.  
While Stormwatch team flies away, The mad hero falls down in a carrousel where is ...Pitt. A new battle is about to began. 
Besides, elsewhere, Simple SImon finds Grizlock's secret laboratory. Another problem for our hero.
name: Supreme Madness, Part 4

description: The devilishly extra-sized 50th issue of THE DEMON looks back at an untold tale of Etrigan from the 16th century when a mad pirate captain literally sailed to Hell to plunder Lucifer's treasure chest. Aboard his ship is seaman Jason Blood, whose demonic alter ego lends an especially infernal twist to the pirate's quest.
name: The Shanty of Captain Scumm

description: While retrieving the nuclear core from the wreckage of a U.S. ballistic missile submarine the Armorines find themselves under attack by a swarm of savagely mutated sharks! But the real danger comes when they encounter the unidentified vessel that sank the U.S.S. Benchley and mutated the sharks to begin with...
name: Fathoms Below, Part 2 - Frenzy

description: A string of mysterious murders plagues the streets of London -- but more mysterious they seem to be the work of a group of children! What evil can be behind these grisly crimes and can Gilad and the Geomancer put an end to it?
name: A Bloody Day In London Town

description:
With the Malev Empire defeated, Magnus now has to figure out how to bring everyone in the world together and rebuild society and fix all of the problems that now plague everyone in “New World Order.”   
 
1st appearance:

-  Torque (Son of Magnus and Leeja). Birth!
name: New World Order

description: Spider Aliens' homeworld destroyed by Solar The Destroyer.
name: Genocide: The Conclusion, Part 3 of 3

description:
Captain Red, part man and part machine, tells how he came to be what he is today and how his group of followers joined him and how they started a search for a treasure, which leads them to Turok.

Captain Red was a pirate Captain in 1752 and was burring some treasure when he was was transported to the land of the lost. It was here that he met Mothergod who had him subjected to many medical procedures that replaced his body parts with cybernetic implants. The surgical procedures were painful and done without anesthetic.

It was during his captivity that Mothergod was over thrown and he made his escape finding two dinosaur cyborgs were were subjected to the same kind of procedures and a robot named OU82. All of them swore the allegiance to Captain Red and in a way became his new crew.

On their way out of Mothergod's den they were once again transported this time to the "modern era" where they stayed underground trying to learn about the new world until they decide to find Captain Red's old treasure.

Turok is undergoing a test a university when a reporter is pops up and tries to take some photos only to be stopped by Turok and run away. The reporter however in his made dash falls into a manhole and ends up right in the lad of Captain Red and his crew.

First Appearance

  • Captain Red (Esau Vestment)
  • Proto
  • Misfire
  • Robot OU-8-2
name: Captain Red Part 1: Killing Time

description: Atlas has to come to grips with his limitations, and without GoldenRod to aid him in his efforts to defeat the evil Bol and his minions, there may not be much hope for humanity. Aox and Troy's quest to the frozen Arctic to replenish GoldenRod with energy from the Continuum Well ultimately proves successful, but a great sacrifice is necessary in order to achieve their goal. In the end, much is gained, but much is lost. And earth will never be the same again.

Overview

If you were an alien science patrol and you came to earth to abduct some humans for experimentation, would you grab some overweight guy from the mid-West or would you grab a Babe? Our super-strong mystery woman who walked out of the ocean last issue is snatched up by aliens this issue, and we don't seem to be any closer to knowing where she came from or where she's going. This is truly John Byrne at his best, stringing us along with a fantastic story of mystery and adventure spiced with just the right amount of humor! Byrne on a good day is great; Byrne on his best day is Babe!

The Badger's in deep now! The good citizens of Wisconsin are up in arms about rampant cattle-mutilations. The number one suspect is Ham, a wizard who sacrifices animals to influence the stock market. Badger is sworn to protect all animal life, but he's in a real quandary here -- Ham is his boss. Furthermore, Ham claims he has nothing to do with the cattle mutilations.

Is there another wizard sacrificing animals in Wisconsin? Can the Badger clear his boss's good name? And how do Paul Bunyan, Joan Crawford, and an arboreal horror named Woodface all fit in?

R2-D2 and C-3PO search for Luke and Leia, but will their quest leave them dismantled on a decidedly anti-droid Gambler's World? Dark Horse has unearthed a series of strips by the famed Russ Manning and presents them here for the first time ever in color! These strips have been reformatted and expertly retouched by Rick Hoberg, who worked with Manning on the original strips. As a special treat, Star Wars fan and Madman creator Michael Allred has created a classic color cover for this issue.

volume.name: Classic Star Wars: The Early Adventures

description: OverviewThe best Star Wars comics creative team to ever put pen to paper, Archie Goodwin and Al Williamson, unite once again to adapt the second Star Wars movie to comic form. This first of two volumes brings the Marvel Comics adaptation of The Empire Strikes Backback into print for the first time since 1980. Al Williamson's classic art is supplemented by brand-new interior coloring, as well as a new cover by Williamson commissioned especially for this volume.
name: Book One

volume.name: Classic Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back

description:
Overview
Your name is Larry Munro. You've been car-jacked by a couple of gun-toting, sociopathic killers who're making you drive them around L.A. as they rob gas stations, race police vehicles, and set fires. Will your pal Concrete reach you before the gunmen inscribe your name on a bullet? Feel lucky? Action, mayhem, and a peek behind a "killer smile" as only Harvey- and Eisner-award-winning Legend creator Paul Chadwick can deliver.

Overview

Eric Luke (Ghost Special) and Howard Cobb (Virus) bring you the stunning finale of "The Machine: Under My Skin," in Dark Horse Comics #24. The twisted creature Flesh controls Mecha for now, but when The Machine dives into the fray, two superheroes may be more than it can handle. The result is too terrible to contemplate, but judge for yourself.

This issue of DHC also brings you the action-packed conclusion to "Aliens: Mondo Pest," as Herk heads into the hive for one last confrontation with more Aliens than even he can count.

Overview
Issue #2 of Dark Horse Downunder, Dark Horse's bimonthly miniseries featuring the best creative talent from Australia, opens with the hilarious "Ashe of the Outback," a story of bloodthirsty terrorists, boat chases, plane chases, car chases, truck chases, submarine chases, seventeen nuns and the bravest man in Australia.

Part 2 of Gary Chaloner and Ashley Wood's "The Undertaker" continues, as Morton and his dead dog Cryptoe discover the horror that lies within the grave of Nod, that most unspeakable serial killer. What they discover could be the most shocking news on earth -- ifthey live long enough to tell of it!

Also in this issue, don't miss David de Vries and Darrel Merritt's "The Berries of the Sun," a spooky tale of one man's search, in a torn and twisted land, for the ultimatesensation.

Legend creator Mike Mignola takes us on a rollercoaster ride of supernatural mayhem in "Hellboy: The Wolves of St. August," part one of a terrifying new four-part adventure. Somewhere in darkest Europe, one hundred thirty-seven people lost their lives, each cruelly torn to pieces -- all in one night. Only Hellboy could investigate such an atrocity and only in the pages of Dark Horse Presents!

Once again, Gary Davis brings us a tale of jealousy, greed, love, and despair in a new "Paleolove." Daishon has located a kind village that takes him and the baby in, but at what cost to him, the child, or the village?

The cryptic Nanny Katie has never aged during her time on this earth. One man discovers why, but the knowledge comes too late to do him any good. Don't miss "Sir John's Passing," by the same creators who brought you "An Edwardian Nursery."

Chapters

  • Hellboy: The Wolves of St. August - Part 1 (of 4)
  • Sir John's Passing
  • Paleolove - Part 1 (of 3)
name: Hellboy: The Wolves of Saint August; Sir John's Passing; Paleolove

first_appearance_teams.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

team_credits.name: Bureau for Paranormal Research and Defense

description: A circus on the high seas sounds just like Madman's cup of java, so our dashing young hero aims to take a break from vile villainy for a cruise on the waterways. But when the bash goes bust and the passengers start passing away, Frank (a.k.a. Madman) becomes the prime suspect!
name: Horror on the High Seas

description:
Overview

Sometimes you have to be a warrior just to get through the day, and this is most definitely one of those days. Martha finds herself in the "Promised Land" but she's finding that the Promise may just be another threat. All the forces of the Harmony satellite are trained on Martha, and she's forced to make a decision that will change her life forever!
name: The Promised Land

description: In the droid trade the only use for old units is as spare parts and scrap. So even See-Threepio is impressed when he and Artoo meet veritable antiques Q-E and 2-E, two diminutive Model-Es who have operated a nursery for several generations of Kalarbans. But despite their longevity, Q-E and 2-E carry a horrific secret that could spell the end for all droids!

Everyone knows the story of the last Jedi Knight, Luke Skywalker. But 4000 years before this solitary hero battled to save the universe the Jedi were a wandering tribe of peace keepers maintaining the balance against the dark side of the Force. This is the story of one such warrior, young Jedi Ulic Qel-Droma, as he battles the dark side power of Freedon Nadd to save the planet Onderon from being swallowed by evil!
name: The Freedon Nadd Uprising

volume.name: Star Wars: Tales of the Jedi: The Freedon Nadd Uprising

description:
Part 2 of the 2-part 'Massacre in Metropolis.' In the ruins of Metropolis, Superman battles the alien menace Massacre as the citizens of that fallen city try to rebuild their lives.

Notes:

  • "DC Universe 18" one page advertisement piece with information on the upcoming Chicago Comicon 1994. Included are dates, times and location of the convention plus the creators who will be on hand at the show.
  • Triangle 1994 #31.
  • Chronological continuation from Superman #92.
  • Chronological continuation in Action Comics #702.
name: Massacre In Metropolis!

description: The Life-Power Church of Maxine gets a boost when the members of the band Year Zero become disciples. When a song based on Maxine's teachings catches the world's attention, her personal crusade takes off.
name: Better Red Than Dead!

description: Events become complicated atop Penn Selkirk's penthouse: Batmen old and new fight for the mantle of the bat since Jean-Paul Valley refuses to listen to reason, Catwoman searches for the neural enabler and Robin and Nightwing find themsleves caught in the crossfire. Selkirk summons a helicopter to make his getaway, but finds himself joined on it by Catwoman, with the two Batmen dangling from a cable attached to it.
name: KnightsEnd Part 7: Return of the Bat

description: Environmental activist Diego Rivera has been poisoned, and only Poison Ivy can save her. But will she?
name: Toxic Shock

description: Hellbent on exacting one final bit of retribution for Sherilyn's fate, Black Orchid snares Logos CEO Eliot Weems in a web of romantic deception only to discover that Weems is playing an integral role in the propagation of her kind.
name: Mr. Weems Takes A Wife

description:
Death of the Endless comes for Tim Hunter...but she's only one of several forces deciding the young magician's fate, even as his true parentage is revealed.

Tim's father sits besotted at home, wondering where Tim has gone, and depressed about their rift.

Tim is visiting Death in an apartment, having tea, although Tim has a hard time believing that's who she is. He's near death, back in Faerie, and she brought him to her so he won't be in his body, in pain.

Tamlin sits near Tim's body, in horror at what happened to him. He's Tim's father, and yet has barely known him. He flies Tim to Titania, so she can cure him, after Tim helped destroy the Manticore and brought life and magic back to Faerie. Bu she says there is no cure for Manticore's poison.

Death asks Tim why he's so obsessed with knowing who his father is. She tells him that while Bill Hunter may not be his biological father, he's still the man who raised him and the man who fills the role of a father in his life. She finds an envelope, and magically puts it in his pocket.

Tamlin and Titania argue about Tim's fate. Tamlin is tired of living carefree in Faerie, since he once came from Earth. Later, Tamlin casts a spell to sacrifice his life for Tim's. Tim wakes up and finds the envelope. Titania, finding the dead Tamlin and the living Tim, tells Tim that she is his mother, and she curses him for taking away her love, Tamlin.

Tim is tired of all these people, and tells her off, and uses his magic stone to go home, with the envelope still in his pocket.
name: Bindings, Epilogue: Lost Causes

description: During the pursuit for the enabler, the device is thrown down Gotham City bridge. Catwoman must wet her fur and confront dangerous underwater thugs to get it back only to find out that when the price is right, even good intentions can be turned around...
name: KnightsEnd, Aftermath: Catfish

description: Troll is down for the count, but now Damage and his current allies, Wyldheart and the revealed Golden Age hero, are staring down the guns of the Baron's henchmen. Plus, the New Titans arrive to arrest Damage for the destruction caused by his battle with Troll.
name: Blast From the Past

description: Part 1 of the 2-part 'Masquerade': Dorothy once again is losing control of her powers, threatening Violet Valley with a takeover by African spirit dancers and sitcom housewives.
name: Two Mad Men With Foreheads and Boots

description: Flash chases after Bart Allen (aka Impulse), while his girlfriend Linda Park is targeted by Kobra in "Reckless Youth, Chapter 2: Quick Study". Part 2 of 3, continued from the previous issue. Story continues next issue.
name: Reckless Youth Part 2: Quick Study
